---
title: Cluster Headache
---


# Epidemiology

- Men > women
- May be associate w Horners syndrome (myosis, ptosis, anhidrosis) 

# Etiology

- Unknown
- Genetic factor: (+) Family hx


# Pathophysiology

- Trigemino-autonomic reflex
- Hypothalamus? Unclear

# Clinical Presentation

## Time
15 min to 2 hours

## Triggers

- Neck mvmts may trigger them or may not

## Symptoms

- Unilateral
    - May change sides
- Location: Temporal, frontal, or retroorbital , occipital pain
- Need at least 5 attacks unilaterally, 15 min-3 hours 
    
    - Probs to sympathetic nerves of face

# Treatment

- Stress reduction
- [Vagal nerve stimulation]({{< var ref-vagal-nerve-stimulation.path >}}) (non invasive)
- C/s strength and mobility
- Consider the T/S as well
